meanings.definition: The quality or state of being eligible for re-election.
meanings.sent1: Her reeligibility as class president was a result of her hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: The mayor's reeligibility depends on the satisfaction of the voters.
meanings.sent3: The reeligibility of the cat for another nap was undeniable as it curled up on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's reeligibility for the championship was akin to a marathon runner's endurance.
meanings.sent5: The reeligibility of the plant for growth was evident in its thriving leaves.

meanings.definition: The ability to be considered for re-election.
meanings.sent1: His reeligibility for the position was a topic of discussion among the committee members.
meanings.sent2: The senator's reeligibility was uncertain due to recent controversies.
meanings.sent3: The reeligibility of the clown for another performance brought smiles to the audience.
meanings.sent4: The student's reeligibility for the debate team was like a ticket to intellectual growth.
meanings.sent5: The reeligibility of the battery for another charge was crucial for the flashlight to work.
